endpoints.description: Retrieves all the fulfillment policies associated with the specified marketplace.

queryParameters.name: Marketplace ID
queryParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

endpoints.description: Retrieves the fulfillment policy associated with the specified fulfillment policy ID.

pathParameters.name: Fulfillment Policy ID
pathParameters.description: A unique eBay-assigned ID for a fulfillment policy that's generated when the policy is created.

queryParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: Name
queryParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the user-defined name of the fulfillment policy you want to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: Marketplace ID

endpoints.description: Retrieves a seller's account privileges (e.g., selling limits and registration status).
endpoints.name: getPrivileges
getOptedInPrograms
endpoints.description: Retrieves the eBay seller programs for which the seller has "opted-in."
Returns details about the shipping rate tables defined by the seller for the counrty specified.
endpoints.name: getRateTables

queryParameters.name: Country Code
queryParameters.description: A two-letter ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code that specifies the country for which you want shipping rate table information. If you do not specify a county, the call returns all the seller-defined rate tables.

pathParameters.name: Return Policy ID
pathParameters.description: A unique eBay-assigned ID for a return policy that's generated when the policy is created.

queryParameters.name: Name
queryParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the user-defined name of the policy you want to retrieve.

endpoints.description: Retrieves the sales tax table for the specified country. The sales tax table is defined by the seller and is comprised of entries for the different jurisdictions in the country.
endpoints.name: getSalesTaxes

queryParameters.name: Country Code
queryParameters.description: A two-letter ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2.

endpoints.name: getSalesTax
endpoints.description: Retrieves a sales tax table entry, as specified by a jurisdiction in a country.

pathParameters.name: Jurisdiction ID
pathParameters.placeholder: Unique ID for a sales tax jurisdiction
pathParameters.description: Unique ID for a sales tax jurisdiction.

pathParameters.name: Country Code
pathParameters.description: A two-letter ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2.

endpoints.name: getInventoryLocations
endpoints.description: This call is used to retrieve a list of inventory locations as defined by the seller.

endpoints.name: getInventoryLocation
endpoints.description: This call is used to retrieve the details of the specified inventory location.

pathParameters.name: Merchant Location Key
pathParameters.description: A unique merchant-defined key (ID) for an inventory location. This value is passed in at the end of the call URI to specify the inventory location to retrieve.

endpoints.description: This call retrieves all inventory item records defined for the seller's account.
endpoints.name: getInventoryItems

endpoints.description: This call retrieves the inventory item record for a given SKU.
endpoints.name: getInventoryItem

pathParameters.name: SKU
pathParameters.description: This is the seller-defined SKU value of the product whose inventory item record you wish to retrieve.

endpoints.name: getInventoryItemGroup
endpoints.description: This call retrieves the inventory item group for a given inventoryItemGroupKey value.

pathParameters.name: Inventory Item group Key
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of an inventory item group. This value is assigned by the seller when an inventory item group is created. The inventoryItemGroupKey value for the inventory item group to retrieve is passed in at the end of the call URI.

endpoints.name: getProductCompatibility
endpoints.description: This call is used by the seller to retrieve the list of products that are compatible with the inventory item.

pathParameters.name: SKU
pathParameters.description: This is the seller-defined SKU value of the product whose inventory item record you wish to retrieve.

endpoints.name: getOffers
endpoints.description: This call retrieves all existing offers for the specified SKU value.

queryParameters.name: SKU
queryParameters.description: The seller-defined SKU value is passed in as a query parameter. All offers associated with this product are returned in the response.

queryParameters.name: Format
queryParameters.description: This enumeration value sets the listing format for the offer. This query parameter will be passed in if the seller only wants to see offers in this specified listing format.

queryParameters.name: Marketplace ID
queryParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

endpoints.name: getOffer
endpoints.description: This call retrieves a specific offer.

pathParameters.name: Offer ID
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of the offer that is to be retrieved.

endpoints.name: getListingFees
endpoints.description: This call is used to retrieve the expected listing fees for one to 250 unpublished offers.

bodyParameters.name: Offer ID
bodyParameters.description: The unique identifier of the offer that is to be retrieved.

endpoints.name: getListingViolationsSummary
endpoints.description: This call returns listing violation counts.

queryParameters.name: Compliance Type
queryParameters.description: A user passes in one or more compliance type values through this query parameter. See ComplianceTypeEnum for more information on the compliance types that can be passed in here. If more than one compliance type values is used, delimit these values with a comma. If no compliance type values are passed in, the listing count for all compliance types will be returned.

endpoints.name: getListingViolations
endpoints.description: This call returns specific listing violations for three different compliance types.

queryParameters.name: Compliance Type
queryParameters.description: A user passes in one or more compliance type values through this query parameter. See ComplianceTypeEnum for more information on the compliance types that can be passed in here. If more than one compliance type values is used, delimit these values with a comma. If no compliance type values are passed in, the listing count for all compliance types will be returned.

queryParameters.name: Listing ID
queryParameters.description: This query parameter is used if the user wants to view all listing violations for one or more eBay listings. The string value passed into this field is the unique identifier of the listing, sometimes referred to as the Item ID. If this query parameter is used, all other query parameters (if provided) are ignored. Either the listing_id or a compliance_type query parameter must be used, and if the seller only wants to view listing violations of a specific compliance type, both of these parameters can be used.

endpoints.name: getOrders
endpoints.description: Search for and retrieve the details of multiple orders.

queryParameters.name: Order IDs
queryParameters.description: A comma-separated list of the unique identifiers of the orders to retrieve (maximum 50). These values were originally generated by eBay as a result of the buyer's checkout process

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description:
One or more comma-separated criteria for narrowing down the collection of orders returned by this call. These criteria correspond to specific fields in the response payload. Multiple filter criteria combine to further restrict the results. Here is an example of a getOrders method using all of these filters: 
GET https://api.ebay.com/sell/v1/order?
filter=creationdate:%5B2016-03-21T08:25:43.511Z..2016-04-21T08:25:43.511Z%5D,
lastmodifieddate:%5B2016-05-15T08:25:43.511Z..%5D,
orderfulfillmentstatus:%7BNOT_STARTED%7CIN_PROGRESS%7D

Note: This method requires that certain special characters in the URI query string be percent-encoded: 
[ = %5B
       ] = %5D
       { = %7B
       | = %7C
       } = %7D 
This query filter example uses these codes.

endpoints.name: getOrder
endpoints.description: Retrieve the details of a specific order.

pathParameters.name: Order ID
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of the order. This value was returned by the getOrders call in the orders.orderId field; for example, 170009092860-9849164007!140000000544476.

endpoints.name: getShippingFulfillments
endpoints.description: Retrieve the details of all shipping fulfillments defined for an order.

pathParameters.name: Order ID
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of the order. This value was returned by the getOrders call in the orders.orderId field; for example, 170009092860-9849164007!140000000544476.

endpoints.name: getShippingFulfillment
endpoints.description: Retrieve the details of a specified shipping fulfillment definition for an order.

pathParameters.name: Order ID
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of the order. This value was returned by the getOrders call in the orders.orderId field; for example, 170009092860-9849164007!140000000544476.

pathParameters.name: Fulfillment ID
pathParameters.description: The unique identifier of the fulfillment. This eBay-generated value was created by the Create Shipping Fulfillment call, and returned by the getShippingFulfillments call in the fulfillments.fulfillmentId field; for example, 9405509699937003457459.

endpoints.name: findSellerStandardsProfiles
endpoints.description: Retrieves all the seller's profiles.

endpoints.name: getSellerStandardsProfile
endpoints.description: Retrieves a seller's profile based on the specified program and cycle.

pathParameters.name: Program
pathParameters.description: Specifies the program of the requested profile.

pathParameters.name: Cycle
pathParameters.description: Specifies the cycle of the requested profile

endpoints.name: getTrafficReport
endpoints.description: Generates a seller's traffic report based on specified days or listings. You can specify the metrics to include in the report and use filters to refine the data returned.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: Specifies a single metric to be sorted and whether you want to sort in ascending or descending order. Specifying a metric in this field, sorts that data in ascending order. To sort in descending order add - in front of the metric. This is helpful when the seller wants to see metrics starting with the greatest number, such as the CLICK_THROUGH_RATE (sort=-CLICK_THROUGH_RATE).

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description: Limits the report data returned. You can refine the report data returned using the date_range, listing_ids, and marketplace_ids filters.

queryParameters.name: Metric
queryParameters.description: Specifies a comma separated list of the metrics you want included in the report.

queryParameters.name: Dimension
queryParameters.description:
For example: 
 * If you specify dimension=day and metric=CLICK_THROUGH_RATE, the traffic report would contain the number of times a buyer saw a listing impression and then clicked through to the listing page for each day in the date range.
 * If you specify dimension=listing and metric=LISTING_IMPRESSION_STORE, the traffic report would contain the number of times that listing appeared on the seller's store.

endpoints.name: getSalesTaxJurisdictions
endpoints.description: Retrieves sales tax jurisdictions for the specified country, letting sellers establish optional tax tables. Countries with tax jurisdictions are CA, IN, and US.

pathParameters.name: Country Code
pathParameters.placeholder: A two-letter ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code
pathParameters.description: A two-letter ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. eBay provides sales tax jurisdiction information for Canada, India, and the United States.Valid values for this path parameter are CA, IN, and US.

endpoints.name: getAutomotivePartsCompatibilityPolicies
endpoints.description: Returns the eBay policies that define how to list automotive-parts-compatibility items in the categories of a specific marketplace.

pathParameters.name: Marketplace ID
pathParameters.description: Specifies the eBay marketplace for which policy information is returned.

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description:
Limits the response by returning eBay policy information for only the leaf categories specified by this parameter. Set filter to a list of categoryId values. You can specify up to 50 category IDs by separating each with a pipe character ('|'). If you specify more than 50 categoryId values, eBay returns a warning along with the results for the first 50 IDs. If you specify a category that has child nodes, eBay returns policy information for all the leaf categories of the parent node. Example: filter=categoryIds:{100|101|102}
 Note that you must URL-encode the list of category ID values, which results in the following filter for the above example: filter=categoryIds%3A%7B100%7C101%7C102%7D

endpoints.name: getItemConditionPolicies
endpoints.description: Returns the eBay policies that define how to specify item conditions in the categories of a specific marketplace.

pathParameters.name: Marketplace ID
pathParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description:
Limits the response by returning eBay policy information for only the leaf categories specified by this parameter. Set filter to a list of categoryId values. You can specify up to 50 category IDs by separating each with a pipe character ('|'). If you specify more than 50 categoryId values, eBay returns a warning along with the results for the first 50 IDs. If you specify a category that has child nodes, eBay returns policy information for all the leaf categories of the parent node. Example: filter=categoryIds:{100|101|102}
 Note that you must URL-encode the list of category ID values, which results in the following filter for the above example: filter=categoryIds%3A%7B100%7C101%7C102%7D

endpoints.name: getListingStructurePolicies
endpoints.description: Returns the eBay policies that define the allowed listing structures (i.e. whether item variations are supported) for the categories of a specific marketplace.

pathParameters.name: Marketplace ID
pathParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description:
Limits the response by returning eBay policy information for only the leaf categories specified by this parameter. Set filter to a list of categoryId values. You can specify up to 50 category IDs by separating each with a pipe character ('|'). If you specify more than 50 categoryId values, eBay returns a warning along with the results for the first 50 IDs. If you specify a category that has child nodes, eBay returns policy information for all the leaf categories of the parent node. Example: filter=categoryIds:{100|101|102}
 Note that you must URL-encode the list of category ID values, which results in the following filter for the above example: filter=categoryIds%3A%7B100%7C101%7C102%7D

endpoints.name: getNegotiatedPricePolicies
endpoints.description: Returns the eBay policies that define the supported negotiated price (best offer) features for the categories of a specific marketplace.

pathParameters.name: Marketplace ID
pathParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description:
Limits the response by returning eBay policy information for only the leaf categories specified by this parameter. Set filter to a list of categoryId values. You can specify up to 50 category IDs by separating each with a pipe character ('|'). If you specify more than 50 categoryId values, eBay returns a warning along with the results for the first 50 IDs. If you specify a category that has child nodes, eBay returns policy information for all the leaf categories of the parent node. Example: filter=categoryIds:{100|101|102}
 Note that you must URL-encode the list of category ID values, which results in the following filter for the above example: filter=categoryIds%3A%7B100%7C101%7C102%7D

endpoints.name: getReturnPolicies
endpoints.description: Returns the eBay policies that define whether or not you must include a return policy for the items you list in the categories of a specific marketplace.

pathParameters.name: Marketplace ID
pathParameters.description: Use this query parameter to specify the eBay marketplace related to the policy you want to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: Filter
queryParameters.description:
Limits the response by returning eBay policy information for only the leaf categories specified by this parameter. Set filter to a list of categoryId values. You can specify up to 50 category IDs by separating each with a pipe character ('|'). If you specify more than 50 categoryId values, eBay returns a warning along with the results for the first 50 IDs. If you specify a category that has child nodes, eBay returns policy information for all the leaf categories of the parent node. Example: filter=categoryIds:{100|101|102}
 Note that you must URL-encode the list of category ID values, which results in the following filter for the above example: filter=categoryIds%3A%7B100%7C101%7C102%7D

deletePaymentPolicy

operations.name: createOrReplaceSalesTax
operations.description: Creates or updates a sales tax table entry, as specified by a jurisdiction in a country.

operations.name: deleteSalesTax
operations.description: Deletes a sales tax table entry, as specified by a jurisdiction in a country.

operations.name: createInventoryLocation
operations.description: This call is used to create a store or warehouse location for the associated seller.

operations.name: updateInventoryLocation
operations.description: This call is used to update the details of a specified inventory location.

operations.name: enableInventoryLocation
operations.description: This call is used to enable a disabled inventory location.

operations.name: disableInventoryLocation
operations.description: This call is used to disable the specified inventory location.

operations.name: deleteInventoryLocation
operations.description: This call is used to delete the specified inventory location from the seller's account.
This call creates a new inventory item record or updates an existing inventory item record.
operations.name: createOrReplaceInventoryItem

operations.description: This call is used to delete an inventory item record associated with a specified SKU.
operations.name: deleteInventoryItem

operations.description: This call is used by the seller to create or replace a list of products that are compatible with the inventory item.
operations.name: createOrReplaceProductCompatibility

operations.description: This call is used by the seller to delete the list of products that are compatible with the inventory item.
operations.name: deleteProductCompatibility
createOrReplaceInventoryItemGroup
operations.description: This call creates a new inventory item group or updates an existing inventory item group.

operations.name: deleteInventoryItemGroup
operations.description: This call deletes the inventory item group for a given inventoryItemGroupKey value.

operations.name: createOffer
operations.description: This call creates an offer for a specific product on a specific eBay marketplace

operations.name: updateOffer
operations.description: This call updates an existing published or unpublished offer.
This call Creates or updates an existing published or unpublished offer.
operations.name: createOrUpdateOffer
deleteOffer
operations.description: This call deletes a specific published or unpublished offer.

operations.name: publishOffer
operations.description: This call is used to convert an unpublished offer into a published offer, or live eBay listing.

operations.name: publishOfferByInventoryItemGroup
operations.description: This call is used to convert all unpublished offers associated with an inventory item group into a published offer.

operations.name: createShippingFulfillment
operations.description: Define a package and its shipping information for an order.
